summary:
## Summary

The Sargasso Sea is a unique area in the North Atlantic Ocean. It's surrounded by four currents that form a giant circle, called a gyre. Unlike other seas, it doesn't have any land around it. It's known for its brown seaweed called Sargassum and clear, deep blue water.  Bermuda is nearby. The sea's calm waters and mysterious nature have inspired many stories and artworks.
title: Sargasso Sea
